question: Leighton was a keen traveller and during his trips he would make small landscape studies of the places he visited. Which city is shown in <image 1>?
description:
The image depicts a nocturnal scene featuring a prominent minaret with a conical roof, characteristic of Islamic architecture. The minaret is part of a larger structure, possibly a mosque, situated within a walled area. The walls have a light-colored appearance, and there are several buildings with flat roofs surrounding the minaret. The sky is dark blue, indicating it is nighttime, and there are a few lights visible in the windows of the buildings, casting a warm glow. In the background, there are silhouettes of trees and hills, adding depth to the scene. The overall atmosphere suggests a Middle Eastern or North African setting.

Given the architectural style of the minaret and the surrounding structures, along with the geographical features, the city depicted in the image is most likely:

B. Cairo
